Simulated project and phylogenetic data

Source: R/data.R
sim_data.Rd

Simulated data for prioritizing conservations projects.

data(sim_project_data)

sim_project_data

sim_tree

Format

sim_project_data

data.frame object

sim_tree

phylo object.

Details

The data set contains the following objects:

sim_project_data

A data.frame containing data for six simulated conservation projects. Each row corresponds to a different project and each column contains information about the projects. This table contains the following columns:

"name"

character name for each project.

"cost"

numeric cost for each project.

"success"

numeric probability of each project succeeding if it is funded.

"locked_in"

logical indicating if certain projects should be locked into the solution.

"locked_out"

logical indicating if certain projects should be locked out of the solution.

"S1" ... "S5"

numeric columns for each species (i.e. "S1", "S2", "S3", "S4", "S5", indicating the enhanced probability that each species will survive if it funded.

sim_tree

A phylo phylogenetic tree that describes the evolutionary relationships between five simulated species. These species are named: "S1", "S2", "S3", "S4", and "S5".

Examples

# load data
data(sim_project_data, sim_tree)

# print project data
print(sim_project_data)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 10
#>   name         cost success locked_in locked_out    S1    S2     S3    S4    S5
#>   <chr>       <dbl>   <dbl> <lgl>     <lgl>      <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 S1_project   94.4   0.847 FALSE     FALSE      0.802 0     0      0     0    
#> 2 S2_project  101.    0.969 FALSE     FALSE      0     0.808 0      0     0    
#> 3 S3_project  103.    0.732 FALSE     TRUE       0     0     0.678  0     0    
#> 4 S4_project   99.2   0.979 FALSE     FALSE      0     0     0      0.703 0    
#> 5 S5_project   99.9   0.714 TRUE      FALSE      0     0     0      0     0.657
#> 6 baseline_p~   0     1     FALSE     FALSE      0.293 0.388 0.0120 0.195 0.124
# print phylogenetic tree
print(sim_tree)
#> 
#> Phylogenetic tree with 5 tips and 4 internal nodes.
#> 
#> Tip labels:
#> [1] "S3" "S1" "S5" "S2" "S4"
#> 
#> Rooted; includes branch lengths.

# plot phylogenetic tree
plot(sim_tree)
